author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1680622556}
review:
Spielwertung: 5/10
Spieldauer: 2.5 Stunden (Die 4 Stunden Spielzeit rÃ¼hren von fast 100 Stunden "Idle" von 2014, also nicht tÃ¤uschen lassen)
SpieldurchlÃ¤ufe: 1 (Ende)

Seltsame Rezensionen... Das Spiel ist in Ordnung

Man liest direkt auf der 1. Seite der Rezensionen diverse Meldungen, die ich so nicht bestÃ¤tigen kann:

1. Das Spiel ist verbuggt! Komisch, gefunden habe ich keine... Es gab keinerlei AbstÃ¼rze und der einzige "Bug" sind diverse GegenstÃ¤nde, in die man hineinlaufen kann und dadurch kurz Graphikglitches hat (z.B. Kisten)
2. Das Spiel hat kein Speichersystem! Komisch, ich bin mehrere Male gestorben und wurde sofort wieder an einen (sehr nahen) Autosave-Point geladen. Ich hatte nie einen "Spielverlust" von mehr als max. 1 Minute. AuÃŸerdem sieht man sehr hÃ¤ufig die "Feder" als Zeichen des Autosaves. 

Ich selbst habe nur ein Ã„rgernis, das ich dem Spiel ankreide:

Direkt nach dem Start, du bist vielleicht 10 Minuten im Spiel, geht es nicht mehr weiter. Egal was du machst, du findest keine Wege / GegenstÃ¤nde mehr. Nach 5-10 Minuten Rumgerenne habe ich hier frustriert den Guide aufgemacht (danke dafÃ¼r) und die LÃ¶sung gefunden: [spoiler]Man muss die Wachen "beklauen", also von hinten anschleichen. Schade nur, dass das nie erklÃ¤rt wird...[/spoiler]
Bis auf diesen Stolperstein ist das Spiel aber 100% lÃ¶sbar. Klar, hier und da hakt es mal kurz, aber wirkliche KopfnÃ¼sse sind nicht dabei. 

Ansonsten bleibt nicht viel zu sagen. Warum trotzdem "nur" 5 von 10 und damit gerade so "Daumen hoch"?

- Das Spiel ist verdammt kurz
- Die Graphik ist bescheiden. Nicht schlimm fÃ¼r ein kleines Projekt, das auch knapp ein Jahrzehnt alt ist, aber meh...
- Die ganze Story wirkt eher blass, anders als ein paar andere SpielerInnen habe ich keine groÃŸe "AtmosphÃ¤re" beim Spielen verspÃ¼rt.

Fazit: Ein Satz, den ich hier mehrmals gelesen habe, fasst das Spiel gut zusammen: Es ist nichts Besonderes, einfach Durchschnitt. Kein Grund fÃ¼r die tiefrote Abwertung. Sollte man sich das Spiel kaufen? Lieber nicht. Bietet das Spiel Adventure-Freunden einen Reiz? Kommt auf den Sichtwinkel und die Toleranzschwelle an. HÃ¤tte ich mir das Spiel gekauft? Hell no! Ist es zu schlimm, um es zu spielen, falls es qua Bundle oder gratis in dein Inventar wandert? Ich denke nicht...

author: {'steamid': '76561198044119232', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1666895229}
review:
Bought as part of the Steam Scream sale but it's literally unplayable because it keeps crashing. The graphics are also very unrefined (being kind here) and although the initial story and premise are promising, with OK voice-overs initially, it quickly deteriorates in dialog that sounds like it is read from a piece of paper by overly bored voice actors who really don't want to be doing it :P
Main problem is the stability though. It's practically impossible to progress because of the bugs and even though I -want- werewolf games and am very lenient towards bad quality in them, there's a limit and this one went over it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278264641', 'num_games_owned': 1124, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1711617820}
review:
This game is by no means a master piece but at the same time we never get werewolf games. This is a pretty easy game but also easy to get confused and lost. The ending goes from in game to what looks like concept art for the ending and they ran out of time and used that instead of creating the ending for the game, the game is a mess and I have the Error glitch that happened when I first started playing the game where I could not go into the Chapel and that was annoying and I could not find any way to fix it. I ended up just leaving the game alone and playing again days or weeks later and it worked. 

This game is not good but it also doesn't cost that much. Currently without sale it costs $2.99 USD and I think that is a fair price, you are not paying for a master piece and to be honest I enjoyed it enough for that price. The transforming into a werewolf was cool, being able to kill the guards and other people also cool but you don't have to and there are different endings depending on what you do. So, for all of that I think it is worth it but again this game isn't perfect or great but just good.

And also for that same price you receive the soundtrack for the game which is really nice and not needed so that is a bonus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150273436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1651805309}
review:
First, keep in mind this is a $3 indie game using a non common game engine . From my experience of having to learn how to loot with control and going behind guards . Was a serious pain. Since, this game lacks tutorials and relies on the lunar puzzle approach on gaming . Even, in I (inventory ) / options you don't see all the controls you can do. 

 This game uses I as inventory , M for maps , shift to run, control to crouch, wasd for walking , and left mouse click for interactions . Once, you get use to that. (Unless your on a xbox / ps / nintendo controller . Best of luck trying to figure out what does what . )

 Guise of the wolf is kinda like a early gamecube game. Where polys and textures are small. If you're expecting a game like fnaf or games that sell for $5 with a small team running unity or more commonly unreal engine . This game uses a different engine from what I can tell . 

For the most part once, you understand the controls . You can easily speed run through this game . Sure not all objects have hit detections and the werewolf chase momments are iffy . This game oddly has charm in a weird way .

  Is it worth $3 ? Well what do you expect for a old short game ? The price feels right and it's not much . For a simple game this could be so much worse. An I do hope the devs someday attempt a remake to address and fix issues in this game . Otherwise , for $3 this is so much better than the shovelwere on Nintendo switch eshop . 

 Would I recommend this game to kids or people who don't play logic puzzles . That really depends if you wan't to experience a game that feels like a 2004 game . Not that it's a bad thing. But, it feels like a time capsole in more than, 1 way .

 With a 16 gb crucible ram card this game plays at 100-120 fps usually . If your worried about, visuals and graphics . Try playing that game with reshade and texture packs to help make the game look newer if you want stuff like ray tracing . 

 In my time spent playing this game. Yes there was issues, yes I was angry. But, when I got past those hiccups . I found myself having fun . I wouldn't say this game is bad . I did beat half the game already . So, if the devs just updated the voice acting and polished the textures some. Heck yeah this game should be $6 if it ever got fixed where it needs it the most .

author: {'steamid': '76561198011726945', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1633373219}
review:
You can tell by looking at it that the creators did have ambition while making this: the story's interesting and the atmosphere is surprisingly great as well alongside with the soundtrack. Yes the realization is considerably janky, but it does have it's charm, not to mention that it reeks of retarded 90s adventure game mechanics in a semi-nostalgic way. You know back when you had to click all over the place to find the seemingly unimportant crap at the randomest of places that which turned out to be essential for story progression, or when the gameplay designer had envisioned a puzzle which he considered to be a genius concept, opposed to the rest of the planet's population who couldn't figure out a solution for said puzzle even if their lives depended on it. This one has it all, freshly sparkled with some janky werewolf transformation based gameplay mechanics as well just to top it all off. 

I enjoyed myself in the 2.7 hours it took for me to finish the adventure.

Just to get this straight: The game is not exactly g o o d, HOWEWER I've played much MUCH worse games than this. Shameless Unity asset flip games with no background music whatsoever whose achievements were glitched or in other cases games that simply refused to run at all, that would just randomly hard crash themselves (then next-gen console ports of them nonetheless) in every instance at the exact same point of the game, irreversibly halting their progression for the rest of time.

Compared to all that...this one ain't so bad.

P.S.: The Enter key related resolution glitch from TotalBiscuit's video is no longer present, so don't be afraid to press Enter in-game. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127104319', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1630849651}
review:
[h1]The Bugs[/h1]
Okay, let's get this out of the way first. Everyone I have ever seen talking about or playing the game has encountered several bugs, glitches or crashes. I have no idea what happened, but I have been able to play the entirety of the game without any of it! It never crashed on me and I did not encounter a single bug.

[h1]The Room of video games[/h1]
When choosing between recommending this game or not recommending this game, one has to choose what qualifies as a recommendation. If we're looking at artistic talent, gameplay mechanics, story and a good engine with solid graphics- this ain't it. However, this game is in the territory that it's so bad, it's good again- and I thoroughly "enjoyed" my time with it.

The graphics are nostalgic, but at the same time completely butchered. The voice acting is on par with The Room as is the writing in this game. The music was dreadful, yet set the tone pretty well. The quote "Good evening me lord- Helps to have a map" has deserved the same status as "I did not hit her, I did not- oh hi Mark" which is a beautiful thing.

[h1]Making it unnecessarily long[/h1]
Another thing both Guise of the Wolf and The Room have in common is that it's 75% filler. This game will make you walk the same few rooms over and over again until you can navigate around them blindfolded.
It will release fetch-type quests, making you go through the entirety of the map- often more than once as well because the game refuses to give any hints about its vague quests.

Here's a good example, spoilered:
[spoiler]In the end, the game requires you to put the amulet the princess gives you (without ever telling anything about it) on a statue. It never tells you this, hints at this and the quest log simply states "I need to find the king" (I can't remember their names). Without looking at a let's play directly, chances are you'll never find out about this on your own and remain stuck- get frustrated and never finish it. It's the same when having to fetch Wolf's blood and Feathers- they're hidden incredibly well on random spots- so you can't logic your way to these items.[/spoiler]

There's a good and a bad ending. I apparently got the bad ending and I have no idea what I should do to get the good ending. And frankly, I don't care. Finishing the game is a feat on its own and I'm happy I played it.

The animation that played at the end of the bad ending was also very on par with being like The Room in terms of quality and hilarity.

[h1]So, should you play it?[/h1]
Yes. Yes, you should. It's not expensive, it's fun and it's something completely different from what you're used to. Don't expect good things and don't expect competency. Just expect to have a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048995563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1672796179}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162410824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1708043644}
review:
For starters, I will say, this game IS buggy. I crashed entering new areas until I started pressing F5 to minimize before I entered any new room.

Some tips to save yourself- Make sure you grab the Axe in the starting area or you'll have to restart the game. Press M to find your map (it's there). You can pickpocket guards by crouching with Ctrl and clicking. Your game saves anytime you see the feather in the corner. And definitely use the steam walkthrough if you get lost.

However, that said- The game does have a certain charm and appeal. The story, while a bit bare boned, is intriguing and some of the mechanics are actually rather fun. For all the negative reviews about the graphics, they can stuff it. You can see what the game looks like before you buy it and if they buy it anyways after seeing the previews, that's on them. I personally find I like the looks of the building (not the character models). Clearly they devs tried to make a fun and unique experience and I appreciate it. The game could still use a lot of work, but I personally really enjoyed the game, flaws and all.

review:

Ich persÃ¶nlich finde das Spiel fÃ¼r den Preis in Ordnung, manche RÃ¤tsel sind zu leicht, manche zu schwer, aber irgendwie wollte ich immer weiter Spielen. 
Von der Grafik wurde ich zwar nicht vom Stuhl gehauen, aber das habe ich auch nicht erwartet. 
Auf eine ganz merkwÃ¼rdige weiÃŸe hat es das Spiel geschafft mich aber trotzdem zum Spielen zu bewegen. 
Mein Fazit: Wer es mag - freut euch. Wer ein AAA Titel will, kauf dir was anderes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278633233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1511848514}
review:
Bought it on humble bundle for 70 cents, and yet I'm still not sure it was worth the price.  The game starts with some decent atmosphere, wandering through a snowy forest by a castle, setting up a plot where you already know the big reveal due to the title, but all that goes out the window as soon as you begin actually playing the game. It's often unclear where to go or what to do, buggy movement making things as simple as walking up stairs a challenge, and many of the models looking like the first draft that someone forgot to finish.

Despite having the appearance of a horror game, it's closer to a puzzle game, or maybe a first person point and click adventure. There are a few moments that were probably meant to be scary, like a chase sequence early on, but the models are so poorly made it's about as threatening as being chased by a sock puppet, with the only fear inducing part of it being sent back a checkpoint and having to play the game that much longer.

I don't recommend buying this, even as a joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125050502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1538632435}
review:
The game is strait out of the early 90s with the graphics, sound, and gameplay. The graphics look as if they were made in the mid to late 90s the sound is strait out of the 8bit computing world and the graphics remind me of the origional DOOM. The Story is predicable and seemingly uninteresting. The game at least for me, after about 2 hours of gameplay, stopped and showed an error message that I had run out of memmory. The game is in my opnion a remake of the early to mid 90s games that typified the era and did a resonable job, if you like those games good for you however if you are like everyone else I would not recomend picking up this game.

And just to clear up any confusion, I like this game and will continue to play it, making it even harder for me to say that I don't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330907189', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1593536055}
review:
ğŸº---------------------------------[b]ğŸŒ‘Guise Of The WolfğŸŒ‘[/b]---------------------------------ğŸº

Well I know this game is mainly negative based on the reviews but this is honestly one of the better Werewolf games that I know that is out there. I like this game because you can be a werewolf and I don't mind the graphics since the game overall plays pretty well plus the game itself isn't that much money either...to me I just personally think it's decently good for how much it costs plus what it's about.

[b]I'm probably being way to nice about this game huh? That's probably because I love any werewolf themed games really if said game allows you to play as the werewolf...[/b]

Aside from the whole me liking this game due to personal reasons it generally is a decent experience for being $2.99...of course you don't have to agree with me nor do you have to play this game.

ğŸºğŸŒ‘-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ğŸŒ‘ğŸº

[b]You should definitely try this game out despite all the negative reviews since It's not expensive and it's decently fun for what it is. Don't expect good things and don't expect competency within this game.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198093035222', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1526156821}
review:
I recieved this game from a friend quite a few years back (near release) but I have only just recently given this game a good go. I finished it with feelings of frustration and disatisfaction. I felt like this game could have potential but the options menu (or lack of) didn't fill me with much confidence going forward. After a lot of confusion, I discovered that there was an unexplained pickpocketing interaction which definitely left a sour taste in my mouth. An hour or so later, after making reasonable progress, my game crashed. This happened another 7 times. Whenever I would try to enter the "East Wing" I was faced with an instant message that said Bad or Ran out of memory, I can't remember which. This was made worse by the game only having an autosave function; everytime it crashed I had to repeat other tasks to get to that point. Later on, I was tasked with finding the various ingredients for the "Wolfsbane" potion. I found all but one which I had to look up where it was after 20 mins of looking around the castle. Once I had reached the rather anti-climactic finale I had one choice. Presumably I had missed some optional items that would've given me another choice but at that point I was unwilling to restart and see what the other was. 

I felt like this was a intriguing take on a 3D Point and Click Adventure game but the programming, level-design and even the plot was extremely weak. I would not recommend this to anyone.

review: Good evening me Lords! I love this game! It's the best thing I have ever played. Not only is it extremely fun but it teaches many important lessons! Such as: The importance of maps. Maps are extremely useful tools in ensuring one never gets lost and can always know where to go. This game is an action packed experience which is a joy to be a part of. Giving games like E.T and Starwars Battlefront 2 a run for their loot boxes! It is a must buy Map/10 would help to have again. Oh and remember, WE MUST FIND LAZSLO

author: {'steamid': '76561198048757676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1511580483}
review:
No guidance, no directions, and no task/quest information.  You just wander around aimleslly with no explanation as to what you're doing or why you're doing it - or more importantly, how you're supposed to do it.  I stopped playing at the 'brew a potion to help us stop the werewolf' quest, which is quest #2 BTW, because I interacted with every item in the game and talked to every NPC and went into every place.  Nothing let me progress.  I can basically tell I'm probably supposed to break the chain in the chapel, but alas...my apple and my flower are not beastly enough to break a sturdy chain.
I paid 50 cents for this game on sale and I wish I had my money back.
Don't buy it.  Personally I disagree with the lot of the graphical negativity on the game, it looks charming and is pretty good for a small developer like this clearly was.  It's cell-shaded, not hyper-realistic, so it's not supposed to look super realistic.  The music is nice; which is good because if you play it you'll be roaming aimlessly through the castle with two different looping songs for eternity.
Don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130948719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1503790249}
review:
HARDWARE: Win 10x64, i5 3570, GTX 1070. No slowdowns, no crashes. Initial lockups on loading screen that appear to be related to using Windows 10, but I was able to fix (see end of the review).

I was surprised to find I'm actually enjoying this game, given its harsh reviews, It's far from perfect, but it's also far from being a bad game at the current price point of $2.99. I'd probably be annoyed if I were expecting a AAA title and paid $50 for it, but it's fun despite a number of polish issues.

There was a major controversy surrounding this game and its developer's fight with a prominent Youtube reviewer in 2014. I have no dog in that fight, and it's not a consideration in my review.

The game:

 - It has a good fictional premise: you're an alchemist hired to help stop a mysterious beast that has been attacking people in and near a castle, during the Middle Ages.
 - The artwork is great, sort of a combination of cell-shading and 3D. It looks fairly primitive, but there is something about the style that tickles my fancy. I especially enjoyed the courtyard with falling snow.
 - The music is evocative.
 - It's fully voiced. The writing is generally good, with some obvious weak bits. The same goes for the voice acting.
 - It does a good job keeping the plot moving.

The game isn't without its problems:

 - It tries to install an unnecessary component (Ogg Vorbis) when you launch. I decline every time,
 - Running in Windows 10 requires setting Windows 7 + Administrator compatibility modes on the game's executable file, or it freezes on the load screen.
 - The game only supports auto-saves, done every time your journal updates. This means lost progress if you want to quit before hitting a new save point.
 - You can't view the keybinds within the game.
 - Advancing requires reading the manual, because it describes a couple of controls / features you are unlikely to figure out on your own, and they are necessary to understand or you'll get stuck VERY early. However, the manual spoils a couple of surprises that I think are better left to experiencing in-game. You can read my as-non-spoiler-as-possible hints instead:[spoiler](1) You'll need to use the pickpocketing ability early, which requires crouching (CTRL) and using the interact / hand icon while behind your target. (2) To get past the area where you turn into a wolf the first time, you'll need to use your wolf abilities (run and swipe) on more than one target.[/spoiler]
 - Some of the things you must do are fictionally illogical, such as [spoiler] the early requirement to pickpocket guards.[/spoiler]
 - Similarly illogical are the chests scattered about that you can (must?) pick.
 - The map is useless, as it's just 2D sprites and doesn't show your position.
 - NPC models and animations are pretty crude, though they get the job done.
 - Puzzles are super simple, not much above walking simulator level (might be a positive depending on your preferences).

Most of the above are technical / polish issues that could be patched, though it seems unlikely they will be at this point. The underlying game is fundamentally sound, and an enjoyable experience with a little patience for its rough bits.

FIXING THE LOADING SCREEN FREEZE ON WINDOWS 10:

Setting Windows 7 and Administrator mode on the two game executables fixed it for me:

- RIGHT-click on Guise of the Wolf in in your list of games, and select PROPERTIES.
- Select the LOCAL FILES tab, then BROWSE LOCAL FILES
- Open the GAME folder
- Set the two Guise of the Wolf files to Windows 7 and Run as Administrator compatibility mode:

- RIGHT click and select PROPERTIES
- Select the COMPATIBILITY tab.
- Check the box to run in COMPATIBILITY MODE, and set it to Windows 7.
- Check the box to RUN AS ADMINISTRATOR.
- Click OK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077986765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1503302375}
review:
Really enjoy the game so far, I like having to figure pretty much everything out from scratch. HOWEVER devs, if you would please just polish the UI, and fix the loading error when you first open the game it would be MUCH better.

FIX FOR THE STARTUP SCREEN FREEZE:
What has been working for me, is when the first screen appears with the developer names is be sure to click on the screen itself to ensure you are fixed on the game window. After that hit CTRL+ALT+DEL and then when the options window appears, HIT CANCEL. 

At this point a breakpoint error window should appear saying an error occured, and hit OK. This should push you passed the frozen opening screen. I also have only been able to do this playing on the HIGH RESOLUTION settings of the game it may work on normal however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000306394', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1498633961}
review: I really enjoyed the game, although I can't say it's a good game. It's like watching a sci-fi movie or a guilty pleasure. It's very reminiscent of old adventure games, including the bad things like expecting you to use a gameplay mechanic that is never mentioned in order to progress. If you never played a game where you rub every item on everything other hoping something happens, you'll probably hate this game. If you expect it to be AAA graphics and it to hold your hand if you're lost you'll hate it. If you expect a late 90's-00's adventure game it has an interesting castle to explore, puzzles, and simple but solid story to lead you through you'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1495671151}
review:
Tags: 1PRPG - First Person Role Playing
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Between the bugs, the performance issues, the general lack of good ease of use with the interface and mechanics, and the clunky way to activate and complete the action segments, the narrative and tone of the game is brought down significantly to the point where it is a chore to play. Otherwise the general premise of collecting ingredients, brewing potions, dealing with medieval politics and using the moonlight to your avantage to think outside the box as far as navigating the environment were all good ideas but the execution just fails

Note: First time I played the optimization was too poor and I had to abandon play part way through. The second time around I forgot the axe and spent 30 minutes wondering why I could not progress. I ended up settling for watching a speedrun and calling it a day. This always failed to deliver the entertainment for me and it is time I remove it for declutter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964840218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1406176372}
review:
Youâ€™re start out in a random country side and your carriage gets attacked by some unknown creature. You wake up in the middle of a wintery forest area and start to look for your carriage driver. You eventually venture into the abandon castle to find out youâ€™ve been bitten. As it turns out the Lord of the castle called upon you to create a cure for this curse that plagues the castle.
The story is so so. It slowly draws you in and will put many to sleep at the same time. It gives little to no character development and still leaves holes in the story even at the end. For a â€˜horrorâ€™ based game there is very little horror to the story seeing as itâ€™s either laughably bad or easily defeated. They did take some unique turns in making a monster story, like making potions and cures. But it ends slightly clichÃ©, even with two different endings. Donâ€™t get me wrong the endings are nicely done, but youâ€™ve probably seen them before.
The graphics are terribly dated, but thatâ€™s nothing new with Indy games. Even with dated graphics many have found a way to make them artistic looking or add some different qualities to enhance their limitations. One good example is Papers, Please. Itâ€™s a very stressful take on living in a 3rd world country as a boarder security guard. The graphs are utter crap. However shading and simple design help bring the game to a very dreary vivid world. With Guise Of The Wolf it very much reminds me of Theif 2, except it lacks most things. In many areas where a shadow would be cast on someone it shows them in regular lighting. Also many of the characters appear to be BRIGHTER then the surrounding area for some reason. Then when Iâ€™d load the game again it would do a 180 and show the complete opposite of what I stated above. Another thing that stand out is that many of the characters have very very limited movement. The guards of the castle seem to have 3, a women you meet in the kitchen seems to only have 2, and the main bad guy only has 4. Now sure it would be different if they were 2d, but this is a 3d world that would probably be a few more hours of coding to be a little lusher and it drains away from the submersion aspect of video games all together. To a certain extent the graphics set back the experience all together.
The controls are wonky to say the least. They start out smooth, but it seems there are too many unfinished parts of the game. So despite how many times you smash down a button it becomes more and more difficult to wiggle out of a glitch in a piece of scenery. Many times I found myself falling through the world or I would get stuck on invisible pieces of something that would render all the controls moot. Other times I would hit a button to perform a action and it just didnâ€™t work. Like say if I wanted to take something. It wouldnâ€™t grasp a clearly graspable object, but when I hit the same button seconds later it would pick up that same object.
In the end this was just a bad game. It was a good attempt for a indy developer. However due to the graphics and story it would have probably been higher rated if it was released years ago and put more time into it. With dated PlayStation 1 like graphics and bland story I canâ€™t recommend it, but canâ€™t say you shouldnâ€™t avoid it either. Although I will say the things that they did well, like some of the voice acting, doesnâ€™t do enough to redeem it completely. However for the more ADD ridden gamer theyâ€™ll find themselves bored and frustrated. So if you can get it for cheap buy it. Itâ€™s worth a few hours if your really bored. Unfortunately in the end itâ€™s easily forgettable and aÂ mildly regrettable experience.
2.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977441326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1473860258}
review:
Not entirely a bad game.
I mean sure, it'll crash on start, crash during gameplay, and since it only autosaves when it decides to, you'll definitely lose progress.

It's wouldn't be such a bad game if the developers spent another year or so working on it, fixing bugs and having the game make it clearer what you're supposed to actually do at various points in order to progress.

Oh and don't get me started on the ending. I think they literally spent $5 making that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174560197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1460257903}
review:
I love werewolf themed things.  Thus, the reason I got this.  The other reason I got it, was because I thought the artistic touch was well done.  The art is unique and thoroughly different.  Yes, poor dialogue and vagueness abound, but the art style just amazes me.  If you can look beyond the annoying items, and just explore the style, you might find yourself enjoying the environment more than the game itrself.

I remember a time I paid $40 bucks for a game, that came with a free game.  Turns out the free game was the only thing I played...so for the $7 or so bucks, it doesn't pain me too much and I at least get to explore the world.

I hope this company can make other games like this with better dialogue, map, and so forth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042689411', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1449600904}
review:
There are bad games and then there is pain like "Guise of the Wolf"... 

Though the concept might seem quite appealing, the execution is extremely poor.
Guise of the Wolf contains several bugs (even almost two years after release) and annoys with a trivial and boring plot, bad textures and  amateurish animations. 

To me this game is like an unfinished school project and I'm really sorry I wasted money and time on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019205444', 'num_games_owned': 4268, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1444315714}
review:
Guise of the Wolf is a first person puzzle game with a cell shaded aesthetic set in a medieval castle where you play as an alchemist tasked with defeating a werewolf. The twist becomes that you are stricken with lycanthropy and after dabbling in some potions, you unlock the ability to control yourself as a werewolf. Its a game that has charm enough to be playable despite being ripe with imperfections such as stiff animations, clipping through background objects, poor voice acting and seeing through the seems of objects just to name a few.

The bulk of the game, you're in a snowy castle that does a good job of detailing the look and making it convincing as a real place that someone could live in. There's a kitchen, a dungeon, a main hall, a courtyard and so on. The dungeon has bear traps set for the werewolf, so always look at the brown floor to see the rust colored traps. Stepping on one or any kind of death will restart you at the last frequent checkpoint.

There are a few characters to interact with. Some with instructions and other are there just to flesh out an area. They are voice acted and as wooden as the acting is, I'd rather hear it than read it. That's one of the game's issues, hearing the text. Even with the sound cranked up in the settings, the speech from person to person is inconsistent. Some are soft while others are clear.

You'll encounter the werewolf a few times where your only choice is to run. There are levers to pull that will spare your life when a gate comes crashing down to separate you. For a budget game, the werewolf's animation is serviceable, but its basic. Every animation is basic in the game, but at least the characters have moving mouths. Almost nothing else moves though. No one blinks, but they seem to breathe by slowly bobbing at the knees.

When you become a werewolf, you have the ability to dash and destroy objects like twenty stone statues or barricades. You can even maul citizens to death. To transform at key moments, simply stand in the moonlight for long enough until your character drops to the ground and his arms get longer, grow claws and hair. Its a basic system that lets you get to the next area. Your time as a werewolf is limited, the moon on your screen will time how much time you have left. Its a good mechanic.

The game is linear, but you'll still have to search around a bit to discover things like ingredients for a potion or a lever to open a door. You can even see your current objective in the inventory, but its never that far away. Its good if you take a long hiatus from the game.

The controls feel like a lot of other games, mouse to look, keys or controller to move. You have buttons and keys to interact, run, a pathetic jump, map, inventory and cancel. Its a game that is self explanatory that keeps you on point and task. It quarantines you in an area until you figure out how to progress. If you try to proceed without doing what you need to, the game will prevent you from leaving.

You'll need to look in your inventory, select them and find something to use them with such as giving an apple to a prisoner that could kill for an apple rather than saying, "Could I bother you for some food? You see no one has fed me in quite a while, in fact you are the first person I've seen in maybe a day." You'll need an item that breaks down weak doors and drop ingredients in a cauldron to make a potion.

The puzzles are never anything that cryptic and solving one will lead you to the next area in fact the game will often tell you what needs to be done and you figure out how to do it. There are switch puzzles, places where you'll need to mix a potion using a list. Just follow the instructions. You can even pick the locks on a treasure chest by clicking four switches to make four tumblers shift into position. Its a fluff mini game, but its still engaging at the same time.

As simple as these tasks are, there is a moment early on in the game where you need to realize that you're supposed to pick pocket a guard for the key. This is so cryptic and soon into the game that it can turn people away from the game forever. A different guard comically tells you no one is allowed to pass, but he'll let you pass for two hundred gold. Now go loot the castle. What? That's like having a bank tell you, sorry you don't have enough for an account, but if you rob us, you'd have enough.

I have to say the cell shading makes the game stand out in a good way. There are so many games without it, that just look awful. Its better to have something that looks unique and better than cheap. The torches and light affects do a lot to enhance the visuals as well, but upon closer inspection you can see faults with the art style. The black lines are drawn as objects rather than on the textures themselves. So if you put your nose up to something like a book or a bar, you can see black lines floating. One specific giant crack in the wall is just in front of the wall, so if you move, the crack will shift position on the wall. Its nothing game breaking, but its still noticeable.

Guise of the Wolf has a lot of noticeable faults. Walking through bushes and chests. When you click on something in the menu or your inventory, you need to move your mouse cursor off it in order to click it a second time. The fireplaces look tiny compared to the beds. Rather than pushing a door, its the handle you need to interact with, even if there is no handle. The alter in the church is up to your chin, as are some of the tables. Some barrels you can only click on their lower half from far away and last, it just looks funny seeing your hand as a cursor on a character's body parts.

Its two biggest sins are the cryptic pick pocket leads to frustration and its production values fall short. With better animation, the game would excel to its audience, but it still needs some hint that you can pick pocket. These are both things that could be fixed, along with the visual issues and the menu. There is a good game under all of this that people can still enjoy.

While I like the game its tough to recommend with all the hate it gets. I can overlook its faults, because they're all visual and it still manages to interesting to me. The problem is that a few years after the game's release and these minor issues never went away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074204472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1434741560}
review:
If you can get past the bugs and horrid voice acting, the story is quite interesting, if you're into midevil/alchemy. 

In Guise of the Wolf, you play a character who is cursed with lycanthropy, which turns you into a werewolf without your free will. Your main goal is to cure yourself and stop the werewolf who gave you the bite in the first place. Along the way, you learn to control the transformation, to the point only direct moonlight can make you turn. 

I'll rate the game overall in 5 categories: 

Replayability: 4/10 
If you want to get all of the achivements you need a minimum of 2 playthroughs to get all of them (because there's 2 endings).

Graphics: 6/10 
Standard graphics, seems like a cartoon set in 2005, but it doesn't impede the experience.

Story: 7/10
Again, if you're into midevil/alchemy, you'll find this interesting to say the least. 

Voice acting: 3/10
It helps to have a map.

Overall experience: 6/10
Read total below. 

Overall: 5/10

It's not at all a bad game, nearly all of the negative reviews were due to the fact it didn't release trading cards along with it's innitial release which is sad that's all people care about rather than enjoying the game. If you have a couple of hours to kill (if you don't follow a guide and just play the game normally) you'll find a good experience to say the least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066098482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1440336750}
review:
In 17th century Uhorsko, an alchemist named Dominik receives a mysterious invitation, requesting his help in stopping a ravenous beast. 
Dominik's carriage is attacked on his way to the castle of his summoner. Though he is cared for, Dominik suffers from a wound on his arm. 
Soon after, he begins to unearth the secret of the castle; a lupine curse which will haunt him in his search for a cure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021731187', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1438470568}
review:
The game is really buggy and has bad texture.
I could barely walk up the stairs, I finished in stone and was often stopped by an invisible barrier that could re-jump.

Playing in the finals looks like it was still in beta testing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994033900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1658127441}
review: I enjoyed this old-fashioned adventure game a lot, despite some annoyances. The problem with games based so much on puzzles is occasionally you bump into a puzzle you can't solve and that brings your gameplay to a dead halt. I ran into that fairly early on, and if I hadn't found a walkthrough, I probably would have stopped playing. The solution to that particular puzzle wasn't ridiculous -- it made sense -- but I doubt I would have thought of it. And it was a lot of fun running around as a werewolf, smashing pylons... until I realized I'd missed one somewhere in that insanely complicated map. It took me two days to figure out which one I'd overlooked! But overall, if you don't mind the 1990s-style graphics, I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993408708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1434307213}
review:
I paid $1 for this game and it seems like too much. It's buggy, the graphics are not great, the dialog is awful.. I think the sound effects are the worst. Constantly hearing a shrill, low-quality bat squeak every few minutes while in the dungeons is incredibly annoying and makes me want to play with no sound. 

But it does have werewolves, so that's something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006541362', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1422787190}
review:
An exercise in tedium and sloppy gamemaking.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-errr,it ends? and it's pretty short overall,if you follow a walkthrough.

-it's good for comedy value,if you get it for free.

[b]CONS:[/b]

-horrible graphics,fake cell shaded stuff all over the screen,with black lines floating all around,bad models,bad textures.

-horrible sound,repetitive music,voice acting that's so bad it's almost good (for comedy,that is),weird ambience sounds

-bland story,bland characters,I honestly couldn't properly care for anything that happened

-bad level design and quests,unless you follow a walkthrough you're gonna be stuck several times,you probably missed an item in a corner somewhere,good luck finding it

-bad tutorial,several things aren't explained,and the nonsensical item placement doesn't help

Avoid like the plague,unless you somehow get this for free,then by all means play it for 10 minutes to laugh at the overall crappy blandness that permeates this game.

Having stolen a key from the policeman I got to the cellar and I found the person locked in a cage. The captive was presented Filchem and told that the count locked it and prepares to take control of all. Having released Filcha I met it in kitchen and started preparing 1 potion (here I found 1 transformation into the werewolf) the Lycanthropy. Wandering on a dark vault of this lock in search of ingredients at last I find the necessary. I mix hurrah! my potion is ready. the daughter Isabel column tells truth of the count and gives akonit. 
All parts of a puzzle met together, and I realized Filch was the first alchemist the comer here he created a damnation by order of the count. After it I rose against Artemis having refused to create 1 more potion.

Entering a conference hall I see the count Artemis he tells about all ominous acts... About my God Isabel! She was that werewolf who chased me on the lock, about there is no Isabel... You will pay the count!!! I do the decisive course. Isabel refuses to take a potion, suggesting to recover most.

review:
[b]Jetzt wird es mal Zeit fÃ¼r ein halbwegs sachliches Review.[/b]

[b]Es ist ein kleines, verschrobenes RPG ohne den Anspruch auf das ganz groÃŸe Kino, sondern unterhÃ¤lt seine Zielgruppe bestens: Rollenspieler, Old-School Spieler, die FÃ¼nfe auch mal gerade sein lassen kÃ¶nnen.
Mehr ist es dann auch nicht! [/b]

+ eigenwillige AtmosphÃ¤re, die aber bestens funktioniert
+ eigenwilliges/einfaches Gameplay, was ein 80er/90er Rollenspieler locker nehmen wird.
+ interessante/erreichbare Erfolge und Sammelkarten
+ es ist ein einfaches, unkompliziertes Spiel! WeiÃŸ nicht, was die Leute am Anfang treiben, dass sie es nicht in die Burg schaffen. 

+/- die AtmosphÃ¤re, bzw. Grafik/Soundkulisse sollte man vorher auf YT prÃ¼fen. 
Die ist wirklich Geschmacksache.
+/- Bugs und Clippingfehler. Ja, die Steine. Ja, die BÃ¤ume. Ja, der Sound der BrÃ¼cke. 
Ich fand es zum Schmunzeln.
+/- Gameplay teilweise wie aus der Urzeit, z.B. Diebstahl, Inventory, KÃ¤mpfe, keine Karte. 
Aber es passt halt irgendwie gut dazu.

[b]- Preis. 5euro sind einfach zu teuer. Alles unter 2Euro ist ok. Unter 1Euro ist es dann fÃ¼r die Zielgruppe ein Pflichtkauf.[/b]
- Speichern. Kann man nicht, erfolgt automatisch, nach irgendwelchen Triggerpunkten/JournaleintrÃ¤gen. Bei mir wurde das Spiel das erste Mal nach einer Stunde gespeichert. Speichern wird auch nicht extra angezeigt. Wer nach 10-30min. das Spiel beendet wird sicherlich von vorne beginnen mÃ¼ssen. Das ist wirklich absoluter Mist!

[b]Fazit: Dieses Spiel ist nur der kleinen Zielgruppe der 80er/90er Rollenspieler zu empfehlen,wenn das Spiel im Sale ist! FÃ¼r 74ct. im Wintersale, war/ist es sogar ein Pflichtkauf.
Die Abzeichensammler kaufen es sich sowieso im Sale wegen der Karten.[/b]

[b]Edit: Das Spiel beinhaltet auch den wirklich hÃ¼bschen Soundtrack/OST, 11Lieder ca. 34min!
Direkt abspielbar Ã¼ber Bibliothek/Musik.[/b]

Danke fÃ¼rs Lesen, ich hoffe gut informiert zu haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039836934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1420586075}
review:
Guise of the Wolf delivers where many AAA titles have faltered. Truly, this is a remarkable breakthrough in the gaming industry. The studio behind this masterpiece have made their entrance into the gaming world and it looks like they'll be sticking around. My sense of smell actually feels heightened and I can feel the tingling hairs on my nipples as they grow tenfold. Can you smell what the ROCK is cookin? I smell a sequel, do you? But I digress, reviewing time baby. 

The game throws away unconventional and worthless things like clipping. You, the player of masterpieces, will have nearly infinite freedom. No longer will we be limited to roads and paths, this is the FUTURE. The first rock you encounter will have something special cookin' inside of it, so make sure you go in there and look! You won't want to leave-and can't! 

Next, we do away with voice acting. These NPC's do not know what acting is! They are alive! Each one of them feels like a dear friend and every person you encounter shares a special memory with you. When they are harmed you can truly feel their anguish and pain. Don't even get me started on the wolf. It's just like Jakob from Twilight. Hell, I even named him Jakob. He is unmatched in his CGI cutscenes, nearly ruining every other game character with the sheer awesomeness of an ability called existence. The dialogue is very open and you even have the option to say things in different orders. Sometimes, I forget it's a game and howl into the night. Say farewell to your life because this game truly absorbs you into its dark atmosphere. I won't spoil the plot. I can't even fully comprehend it. Its complexity cannot be adequately appreciated until I complete a novel version for all to read. I've already written 9,001 pages and I've barely touched 12% of the whole plot.

You see my friends, you MAKE the plot. The creators took a gamble and allowed YOU, the player of masterpieces, to create your own story. It leaves many plotholes on purpose for your imagination to fill in, making the replay value infinity. 

Beware, once you start this game you may contract a disease known as "Large Dong". I'll let the details be a surprise, but know that you won't want it to be cured. Keep napkins closeby as the female lead is a true Goddess. Her beautiful voice echoes forever in your mind and you'll spend the vast majority of the game not actually playing but searching for this divine Amazonian. She watches over the player giving advice and health/love potions from time to time. You'll fall in love with her soothing voice quickly, so be sure to listen to her. 

Make sure you check the map often. It really helps, the guards told me so and they've seen everything. Everything! Good luck sneaking by them. Additionally, they're incredibly handsome. If you find that you cannot contain your primitive lust I must warn you to be extremely careful when patting them down. The one named Jesom specifically likes his left ear stroked gently. Try it, you'll get a extra 15 gold. 

Play on, friends. This game is the greatest buy of my life, and I bought twelve ladyboys for a night. 

 AWRHOOOOOO!








AWHROOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969750504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1417548737}
review:
I bought this game because of the many reviews and wanted to see for myself if it's really that bad. It is...

This is the most amateurish game i've ever played. Everything is unispired and lazy.
That stupid black outline everywhere, the robotic, visibly resetting animations on the guards, the floating animations on the other NPCs, not explained game mechanics, clipping issues.... i better stop before this list gets to long.

Should i tell about the combat and stealth mechanics?... no they are not worth mentioning because not existend.

It's a shame because the concept is interesting, the atmosphere and lighting are good and i liked the music but you can't enjoy it with all the issues.

To say it with the wise words of the robot-guards: "Keep your bloody distance!"... from this game

pro:
 - +1 perfect game for my achievement list
 - you can play through this masterpiece in ~40 min so you don't have to suffer to long
 - it's good for a few laughs

contra:
 - i had to play it... 3 times
 - 5 wasted hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198041670945', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1423089259}
review:
This game is hilarious in the same way someone falling down a flight of stairs is hilarious. What I mean by that is it's horrible, but it's still sickly funny in that "How could someone (FUN Creations) mess up that badly?". The only difference being that you want to help someone up who's fallen down some stairs, but in this case, the dude is gonna take seven dollars from your pocket. That cactus needle can go fall down another flight for all I care, that was my lunch money.


My only observations on this game have been said a million times before, buggy, terrible looking,  voice actin' is pretty bad, etc. Now I always laughed whenever I saw how deep the rabbit hole went in reference to these qualities, but I'm fairly sure not everyone will see it that way. 


Well, okay, it's soundtrack isn't.... Terrible. 


Point is, unless it's on sale, I wouldn't get it. Even when it's on sale, I would only get it if you're the kind of dude who likes laughing at bad game design. I guess you'll also get access to it's not so terrible music in the music player, and you can get some trading cards as well... So, um, yay? 


Maybe send it as a joke gift? I dunno.


Of course, this is all my opinion. Cross reference mine with others and see if it's a game for you, but it's certainly not on my reccomendations list (Even if I did enjoy it to some extent).


The Bottom Line: Guise Of The Wolf is a game you get for the lelz.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198109333284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1397287943}
review:
[i]Guise of the Wolf[/i] is a beautiful trainwreck.  Pick it up on sale or in a bundle, procure an alcoholic beverage of your choice, and prepare to laugh the night away.

And by prepare, I mean make sure you can actually run the thing.  I had some issues with launch failures at first, and to fix them I had to mess with the DEP settings.  Once it's working, though, it's a fun creation.

Oh, also, to pickpocket guards, crouch, get behind the guard, and click.  This is not explained anywhere ingame, and you do need to do it to progress.  It is obtuse nonsense like this that makes [i]Guise of the Wolf[/i] the true successor to the adventure games of old.

Look, I know it was uncouth of the dev to try censoring TotalBiscuit, but Tommy Wiseau tried the same thing on the Nostalgia Critic and his movie still has fans.  Leave your outrage at the door and laugh at the shitty game.  You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089726157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1411659306}
review:
Pur apprezzando il lavoro del piccolo team che ha sviluppato questo gioco, trovo imbarazzante presentarsi su Steam nel 2014 con un lavoro incompleto.
Sebbene la grafica stile "cartoon 3D" possa essere anche adatta ad un'avventura grafica, le collisioni con gli oggetti Ã¨ trascurata (si passa attraverso alberi ed alcuni oggetti con la possibilitÃ  di rimanere incastrati).
La risoluzione non statica, ed alternando tra schermo intero e modalitÃ  finestra si presentano glitch grafici.
Le interazioni con i personaggi sono pressochÃ¨ inesistenti, e si limiteranno a ripetere 3 frasi a ripetizione (nel caso delle guardie: "Cosa pensi di fare?", "Avere una mappa aiuta" "Buonasera mylord") o a dialoghi preimpostati.
La modalitÃ  "stealth" Ã¨ ridicola, e si imposta semplicemente accovacciandosi premendo il tasto "Ctrl", mentre lo scassinare i forzieri non Ã¨ una sfida impegnativa, e si potrÃ  scassinare davanti alle guardie, sottraendo monete e restando impuniti.
Se una guardia vi vede trasformati in forma mannara, vi attaccherÃ , ma non appena la trasformazione scadrÃ  e tornerete all'aspetto umano, proprio davanti agli occhi, smetterÃ  di attaccarvi, tornando a ripetervi le solite tre frasi.
Le animazioni dei modelli 3D sono orribili, meccaniche ed innaturali, con spesso lo spawn dei personaggi prima della loro entrata in scena ed in luoghi che fisicamente sono incoerenti.
La stessa struttura del castello Ã¨ irrealistica, con stanze e corridoi inutili anche per il castello piÃ¹ "fantasy" mai esistito.
La mappa non mostra la posizione in alcune stanze, ma soprattutto Ã¨ il simbolo della irrazionalitÃ  ed illogicitÃ  della stessa trama di tutto il gioco. PerchÃ¨ avere una mappa "dettagliata" se si Ã¨ "sopravvissuti" ad un incidente? PerchÃ¨ la stessa guardia ti impedisce di uscire dal castello, ma ti propone pure di andare a rubare liberamente nel castello stesso per esser pagato per lasciarti passare fuori? C'Ã¨ molto altro, ed i dialoghi stessi sono, a tratti, di una ignoranza tale da rimanere senza parole.

Il concept del gioco Ã¨ di per sÃ¨ interessante, ma non vale il prezzo del gioco nemmeno in offerta.
Tuttavia confesso di aver acquistato questa perla di "bruttezza" solo per le cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989578511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1634647189}
review:
Maybe one of the worst game I've been played. Even though I actually liked the idea of a werewolf game, you only meet it a few times (a number of three).

+ The dialogues, the only thing the game still has its value. I mean, "Helps to have a map." is so hilarious it could be.
+ I actually liked the achievements

- Bugs everywhere
- See the positive commentary above. The reason why it's hilarious, is that it's sad you can't see or do much in your implemented map. Even though you are in the Dungeon or just in the Count Hall, you can't see your position in the map where you are going or standing.
- Voice actors in general
- The graphics could've been better
- No hints when and how pickpocketing the guards, bad tutorial at all
- Sound bug when being the werewolf
- The werewolf you encounter is really boring
- Boring lockpick mechanism

I'll give this game a 1/10. If you want a bad game, buy this. Otherwise, go and play real horror games where you could be frightened or just having a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083475153', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1390840587}
review:
i will tell you all one thing get out while you still can.. this games is like when plumbers dont wear ties and day one incident have a baby together, but not any normal baby. this baby is literally the satanic beign that tells you a thousands of lies about this game, rubbing with it at your curious face like some freaking sponge tills your face gets eternal bleeding and then take all your money and flips the bird and go thought a second dimension and do it all over again. 

this games never freaking explains where you should go, their is no tutorial that tells you or a freaking singel hint that guide you thought this game btw the grafics it looks like a early beta from 2000. and dont let forget about the models.... oh god the models. it make the werewolf look like a cute littel puppy compare to these freaks. i never completed the game becuse somewhere at i dunno a half through of this game i gave up, i just gave up. glitchy trees and stones, freaking low texture and that bad dialogues. it have a intresting story i must admit that, but it couldnt save from all these flaw. it executed bad.
but if you like to buy this game, search all those glitches by yourself. go ahead but beware who may enter here.  1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982678859', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1399584383}
review:
un juego de 5 muy raspado , graficos simpaticos que cumplen su cometido , una historia casi nula contada o en papel o con npc rigidos como piedras , algun bug subiendo las escaleras ,  este juego es mas bien una aventura grafica de muy bajo presupuesto y probablemente echo con buenas intenciones , solo apto para fans de historias de hombres lobos  ,no espereis accion , 
una lastima puesto que por tematica y demas el juego hubiese podido dar mucho de si  eso si es un juego para pagar unos 2 o 3 euros por el no mas

author: {'steamid': '76561198008206431', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1397491856}
review:
Disappointing.
Now I understand the "Procedural Death Labyrinth" tag.I got lost a few times and without some guides I would be still stuck somewhere at the beginning.

"Helps to have a map." and "Good evening m'lord.", yea sure two sentences are enough.After clicking on a guard like 30 times I wasn't sure if I should laugh or cry.The voice acting is horrible.

The pickpocketing system is terrible.They should have just left the items somewhere on the ground, wouldn't make any difference.I won't even start on the  texture.

The price is a joke.I wouldn't recommend buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963831883', 'num_games_owned': 5283, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1397190462}
review:
This piece of garbage is literally one of the worst things I have ever met on Steam.

Graph is like a very amateurish Quake 1 mod. Yes, it looks like a 20 years old engine ruined by keen but dumb kids.
Quake 2 has much more poligons. Im not joking!
And it has a lot of bugs. Surfaces arent fitting, the "cell shade effect" is a bad joke like the whole game etc.

Options menu: volume control and language selection. Nothing else. Cant change the resolution or bind keys, cant set mouse sensitivity or anything else.
The only reason why its not a big problem is the facth this game is so miserable you wont want to play it anyway.

I walked around on the first map 15 minutes cuz the game is so shockingly bad I forgot myself there. After that I left it run in the background to get the cards out of it so any game time beyond that was only for the cards.

I got this rubbish from a bundle thats why I can write about it without anger but it doesnt worth 1 cent. If u get a key for free give it to somebody u hate.

On the serious note, I actually somehow enjoyed this one. It's crap, don't get me wrong, but I did have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972690145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 75774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5650, 'last_played': 1515614615}
review:
This is the best game I have ever played.  This is the best game I will ever play.  People owe it to themselves to load up GotW, and I'm a little disappointed Steam/Valve haven't bought it on behalf of every single Steam user.  The game has amazing graphics, fluid animation, wonderful mechanics, the best sound effects money can buy (the 'walking on wood' sound was so good I felt I was walking on water) and an atmospheric, chilling soundtrack.

I play this game every day.  Sometimes I pretend I'm actually the main character in person, skulking around the dark, moody castle (my bathroom), whilst other times I pretend to be Isabella and hide from everybody else, no matter how often they get upset and beg me to come out.

Here's my take on the in-game characters:

Laszlo's sadly dead from the start but that very discovery will make you tear up and suck you into the detailed plot.  Even dead characters here put other games' in the shade.

Filch Hoodwink has the misfortune of looking like a creepy child molester and having a name that people often mistake for 'Filth', which doesn't help matters.  It's a shame, really, as all he wants to do is eat juicy, juicy apples.  I've never met anybody that immediately wants to hold a conversation about them, but this man is positively apple obsessed and brings the subject up several times in the game.  He loves seeds too and will hand them out to anybody and everybody at parties.

Isabella, friendly soul, insists she'll be nearby and yet shows up a total of three times in the adventure (one of which involves being rescued at the end), for a combined screen time of probably a minute.  Curiously, despite the brief encounter(s) she seems to hint of a possible romance between the pair of you; Filch clearly doesn't do much for her and, frankly, who can blame her?

Artemis was born with a permanent Roger Moore-esque raised eyebrow which, I'm sure, led to a great deal of ridicule as a child (but fruitful experiences when he was old enough to discover women).  He has the deepest, villianiest voice I've ever heard which must be annoying when attempting to hide villainy motives.  In any case, I hope his sore throat clears up soon; I recommend Wrigley's 'Lockets' which have a lovely, gooey, honey centre.

The guards are all very helpful and uniform (which guards should be!), greeting you cheerfully and pointing you towards your map.  If I found a real guard like this I would want to shake his hand quite firmly for a minimum of no less than five seconds, or until he asked me to stop.

Kitchen Wenchâ„¢.  Unknown motive(s); one suspects cooking food.  Prone to panic.  Prone to face collapsing when killed to death.

I refuse to comment on the wolf itself as overexposure will diminish its quite dramatic entrance.  All I can say is this: once you see it, you will never forget.  Isn't that what we all strive for in life?  I know I do.

I'd like to address some laughable 'negative' points I've come across, both here on Steam and elsewhere:

Stealth.  The stealth system is actually nuanced and in-depth.  Each guard has their weapon on display at all times and an unsuccessful pat down of their bottoms will result in a major tongue-lashing.  I can't explain the sheer euphoria I felt when I managed to steal a key to a dungeon; something I can only claim to have done a handful of times before in real life.  The fact this genre-busting mechanic isn't documented anywhere within the game is entirely the point; you have to get into your character and into the mindset.  Don't be lazy; explore, probe, discover, learn.  Fondle.

Now, I'm puzzled by the negativity in regards to the black outlines.  They are perfect.  They are us.  They accurately convey the darkness we all have in our souls which is, presumably, why Filch 'Filth' Hoodwink is completely encased in blackness at one point.  To remove these outlines is to remove a part of ourselves.  Even the scenery needs these lines; nature can be unforgiving and cruel.

Another gripe seems to be in regards to objects, and the fact many can be walked through.  All I can say is this: if you were trying to hide from a werewolf, I think you'd be thankful you could hide inside a large rock or tree!

Overall, you must buy this game.  This is not a request and it makes me weep to know there are genuine, decent people out there deprived of this experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728484', 'num_games_owned': 3243, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1403988013}
review:
This is a classic example of what happens when you don't polish your product.
There is real potental here, which makes it's failure all the more bitter.
While I found it entertaining for the two or so hours, it's not everyones taste.
I can't recommend buying this title.

Graphics are 5/10  (being kind, I'm a fan of Cell Shading)
Story is a 6/10  (Good concept, terri-bad execution)
Music 7/10   (be nice if you could turn it off, without muting)
Voice 2/10  (All twelve lines of it)
Gameplay   lol/10    (Visit Youtube and watch the first 10 min of gameplay.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198073540985', 'num_games_owned': 2669, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1399606345}
review: Do I recommend this game?  Yes, I do, but not in a good way.  This game is bad.  Everyone already knows that.  I recommend it just so you can see how much of a trainwreck it actually is.  The developers even put you into the drama by not having the Steam trading cards for the game and saying they do on the store page.  They have actually gone that extra mile!  That is dedication to being terrible right there!  Finally, just because I am recommending you get this piece o' crap, please do not purchase it at the insane price they are asking.  I personally got it in a Groupees bundle and ended up paying 50 cents for it.  A penny more and I would have been ripped off.  Buy it cheap, gather your friends around and stare in wonder at this anti-masterpiece.  Revel in the developer's disrespect for their customers.  Just laugh.  Let us hope that others have learned from the mistakes of these guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997992108', 'num_games_owned': 2948, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1545950272}
review:
Well, this game makes it easy to point out its flaws so to make this more challenging I decided to find good things to say about the game!

1. It's short. Only have 2 hours to kill? Here you go! I was called away from the keyboard for about half an hour and still managed to get a time of 2.8 Hours on Steam when getting the "Bad Ending" achievement
2. The falling snow effect looked alright in the courtyard
3.  Isabella has large breasts
4. Gives a good life lesson "It helps to have a map."
5. It does not overburden you with options
6. It gives the illusion of having Steam Trading Cards (at time of posting while the store page says it does, It does not)
7. If you are not into puzzles this is no problem, It only has 3 and one of those 3 is repeated about 10 times!
8. You do not have to waste time waiting for NPC's to move, they tend to not move at all or teleport

And that's all I got for you... Not recommended unless you're a masochist like myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041124482', 'num_games_owned': 1945, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1540949084}
review:
[u][b]This game is totally in the alpha state. There are plenty graphic glitches, stucking places and even bugs in it. [/b][/u]

If you can overlook this problems, you will get a good idea with boring gameplay. 
The NPC just stand around in any corner and talk 1-2 standard sentences. Some of the NPCs give you a little more text and small easy to achieve quests. In my opinion this game is totally not worth 11,99 â‚¬ (~15,00$).

It feels like this game was made by someone, who had a good idea, but not the endurance to make a good game out of it. 

[b]I TOTALLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME IN THIS STATE![/b] 

If the Devs decide to make a full content patch (a really big one), with a lot more life, quests and puzzles in this game and get the bugs, glitches and stucking places out of it, then it would be worth the money. But until then....this games really sucks!

review:
Pile of $#!^, this game made me a bit convinced when it first came out...as someone who enjoyed werewolves and have been wanting a good game based on the classical tales...I tried to like it, I really did, but there's nothing to like. The controls are unexplained, the storyline is bland, the cutscenes and gameplay are exactly the same in quality and the writing is irritating.
